00028 #include <stdint.h>
00029 #include <stdlib.h>
00030 #include <stdio.h>
00031 #include <string.h>
00032 #include <assert.h>
00033 
00034 #include "dict.h"

00036 //............................................................................
00037 static int Dictionary_comp(void const *arg1, void const *arg2) {
00038     uint32_t key1 = ((DictEntry const *)arg1)->key_;
00039     uint32_t key2 = ((DictEntry const *)arg2)->key_;
00040     if (key1 > key2) {
00041         return 1;
00042     }
00043     else if (key1 < key2) {
00044         return -1;
00045     }
00046     else {
00047         return 0;
00048     }
00049 }
00050 //............................................................................
00051 void Dictionary::put(uint32_t key, char const *name) {
00052     if (find(key) < 0) {                                    // is the key new?
00053         assert(entries_ < capacity_ - 1);
00054         sto_[entries_].key_ = key;
00055         strncpy(sto_[entries_].name_, name, sizeof(sto_[entries_].name_));
00056         ++entries_;
00057                                          // keep the entries sorted by the key
00058         qsort(sto_, (size_t)entries_, sizeof(sto_[0]), &Dictionary_comp);
00059     }
00060 }
00061 //............................................................................
00062 char const *Dictionary::get(uint32_t key) {
00063     if (key == 0) {
00064         return "NULL";
00065     }
00066     int idx = find(key);
00067     if (idx >= 0) {
00068         return sto_[idx].name_;
00069     }
00070     else {
00071         // entry not found
00072         sprintf(notFound_.name_, "%08X", key);
00073         return notFound_.name_;
00074     }
00075 }
00076 //............................................................................
00077 int Dictionary::find(uint32_t key) {
00078                                                 // binary search algorithm ...
00079     int mid;
00080     int first = 0;
00081     int last = entries_;
00082     while (first <= last) {
00083         mid = (first + last) / 2;
00084         if (sto_[mid].key_ == key) {
00085             return mid;
00086         }
00087         if (sto_[mid].key_ > key) {
00088             last = mid - 1;
00089         }
00090         else {
00091             first = mid + 1;
00092         }
00093     }
00094 
00095     // entry not found
00096     return -1;
00097 }

00099 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00100 static int SigDictionary_comp(void const *arg1, void const *arg2) {
00101     uint32_t sig1 = ((SigDictEntry const *)arg1)->sig_;
00102     uint32_t sig2 = ((SigDictEntry const *)arg2)->sig_;
00103     if (sig1 > sig2) {
00104         return 1;
00105     }
00106     else if (sig1 < sig2) {
00107         return -1;
00108     }
00109     else {                                                     // sig1 == sig2
00110         return 0;
00111     }
00112 }
00113 //............................................................................
00114 void SigDictionary::put(uint32_t sig, uint32_t obj, char const *name) {
00115     if (find(sig, obj) < 0) {                        // is the (sig, obj) new?
00116         assert(entries_ < capacity_ - 1);
00117         sto_[entries_].sig_ = sig;
00118         sto_[entries_].obj_ = obj;
00119         strncpy(sto_[entries_].name_, name, sizeof(sto_[entries_].name_));
00120         ++entries_;
00121                                          // keep the entries sorted by the sig
00122         qsort(sto_, (size_t)entries_, sizeof(sto_[0]), &SigDictionary_comp);
00123     }
00124 }
00125 //............................................................................
00126 char const *SigDictionary::get(uint32_t sig, uint32_t obj) {
00127     if (sig == 0) {
00128         return "NULL";
00129     }
00130     int idx = find(sig, obj);
00131     if (idx >= 0) {
00132         return sto_[idx].name_;
00133     }
00134     else {
00135         // entry not found
00136         sprintf(notFound_.name_, "%08X,Obj=%08X", sig, obj);
00137         return notFound_.name_;
00138     }
00139 }
00140 //............................................................................
00141 int SigDictionary::find(uint32_t sig, uint32_t obj) {
00142                                                 // binary search algorithm ...
00143     int mid;
00144     int first = 0;
00145     int last = entries_;
00146     while (first <= last) {
00147         mid = (first + last) / 2;
00148         if (sto_[mid].sig_ == sig) {
00149             if (obj == 0) {                                  // global signal?
00150                 return mid;
00151             }
00152             else {                             // signal specific to an object
00153                 first = mid;
00154                 do {
00155                     if ((sto_[first].obj_ == 0)
00156                         || (sto_[first].obj_ == obj))
00157                     {
00158                         return first;
00159                     }
00160                     --first;
00161                 } while ((first >= 0) && (sto_[first].sig_ == sig));
00162                 last = mid + 1;
00163                 while ((last < entries_) && (sto_[last].sig_ == sig)) {
00164                     if ((sto_[last].obj_ == 0)
00165                         || (sto_[last].obj_ == obj))
00166                     {
00167                         return last;
00168                     }
00169                     ++last;
00170                 }
00171                 // entry not found
00172                 return -1;
00173             }
00174         }
00175         if (sto_[mid].sig_ > sig) {
00176             last = mid - 1;
00177         }
00178         else {
00179             first = mid + 1;
00180         }
00181     }
00182 
00183     // entry not found
00184     return -1;
00185 }
